articles.author: Nailia Bagirova
articles.description: The Azerbaijan Airlines plane flew hundreds of miles off its scheduled route from Baku to Grozny, and crashed on the eastern shore of the Caspian Sea. Russia's aviation watchdog said a bird strike might have been the cause.
articles.title: Russian air-defense system downed Azerbaijan plane, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 10 people were killed and more than a dozen wounded in Israeli strikes on Gaza early on Thursday, medics with the Gaza health authorities said.
articles.title: At least 10 killed in Israeli strikes on Gaza, medics say

articles.author: Devjyot Ghoshal, Matthias Williams
articles.description: Singh, the first Sikh prime minister, liberalized the economy as finance minister and saved the nation from a balance-of-payments crisis.
articles.title: Manmohan Singh, India's reluctant prime minister, dies aged 92

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The violence in Tartous province marks the deadliest challenge yet to the Islamist-led authorities which swept Bashar al-Assad from power.
articles.title: Syria's new rulers declare crackdown as tensions flare in coastal area

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Constitutional Court is set to hold its first hearing in a case that will decide whether Yoon is reinstated or permanently removed from office.
articles.title: South Korea's acting president faces impeachment vote as court meets on martial law case

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia's Federal Security Service (FSB) said on Thursday that it had foiled several plots by Ukrainian intelligence services to kill high-ranking Russian officers and their families in Moscow using bombs disguised as power banks or document folders.
articles.title: Russia says it thwarts Ukrainian plots to kill high-ranking officers and their families

articles.author: Yuddy Budiman, Artorn Pookasook, Uditha Jayasinghe
articles.description: Survivors and families of victims visited mass graves, lit candles and comforted one another across Southeast and South Asia in ceremonies to mark the disaster that killed some 230,000 people.
articles.title: Thousands mark 20 years after deadly Indian Ocean tsunami

articles.author: Essi Lehto, Andrius Sytas
articles.description: The Finnish customs service said the ship may belong to the shadow fleet of aging tankers that seek to evade sanctions on the sale of Russian oil.
articles.title: Finland boards oil tanker suspected of causing internet, power cable outages

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's military said it struck multiple targets linked to the Iran-aligned Houthi movement in Yemen on Thursday, including Sana’a International Airport and three ports along the western coast.
articles.title: Israel strikes Yemen's Sana'a airport, ports and power stations

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea's spy agency said it has confirmed that an injured North Korean soldier was captured alive, the Yonhap news agency reported on Friday.
articles.title: S. Korea's spy agency confirms an injured N. Korean soldier in custody, Yonhap reports
